comments.text:
To fetch data from supabase, you have to write a javascript function using the Noodl.Variables.supabase client.

With Noodl AI, you can create a function with the following prompt as a base to work on :
"Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table companies"

(which gave te result in the function node below)
Creates the Supabase client and stores it in a Noodl Variable
Set the localstorage keyName to save the AuthSession
Set the user profile table name

type.name: component
type.title: Choose page component
components: /#Supabase Prefab/Supabase Prefab/Pages/Log in with Magic link

parameters.text:
LINGKOD MARIA COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND
ADVOCACY CENTER
Welcome to the LMCDAC website. Here, you can submit event reports instead of going to the LMCDAC Office.

LMCDAC envisions to become a leading center in forming enlightened, healthy, just, and peaceful communities free from hunger, poverty, and all forms of exploitation. Its mission is to work with people whose lives are dominated by poverty, illiteracy, diseases, and other disadvantages. With a holistic and developmental approach, it strives to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of these people. It also chooses to work with sectors where the Institution's expertise is needed to bridge development in more significant communities.

history.content: Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table schoolyear but only the record with 'is_active' set to true.

This function fetches the active school year record from the 'schoolyear' table using the Supabase API.

It retrieves the data where the 'is_active' field is true. If there is an error during the fetch operation, it sets the Outputs.Error output to the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure signal.

If the fetch operation is successful, it sets the Outputs.ActiveSchoolYear output to the first record in the data array (assuming only one active school year record) and triggers the Outputs.Success signal.

roots.type: /#Supabase Prefab/Supabase Prefab/UI/Supabase - Fetch Current User Auth

history.content: need function to check if the following are blank and valid emails and passwords. Here are the inputs: const email = Inputs.Pass1 || ''; const pass = Inputs.Pass2 || ''; const fname = Inputs.fname || ''; const lname = Inputs.lname || '';

This function validates user inputs for an email, password, first name, and last name.

It first checks if the email is blank. If it is, it sets the Outputs.BlankEmail property to true and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

Next, it checks if the email is in a valid email format using a regular expression. If it is not, it sets the Outputs.InvalidEmail property to true and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

Then, it checks if the password is blank. If it is, it sets the Outputs.BlankPassword property to true and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

After that, it checks if the first name is blank. If it is, it sets the Outputs.BlankFirstName property to true and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

Finally, it checks if the last name is blank. If it is, it sets the Outputs.BlankLastName property to true and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.

If all the checks pass, it sets the Outputs.ValidInputs property to true and triggers the Outputs.Success output signal.
Takes two string inputs then compared the two if they're the same and outputs true if it is, false is it isnt

This function compares two strings and determines if they are equal. It takes Inputs. This function compares two strings and determines if they are equal. It takes and Inputs. and as inputs. If the two strings are equal, it sets the Outputs. as inputs. If the two strings are equal, it sets the output to false.

history.content: Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table schoolyear but only the record with 'is_active' set to true.

This function fetches the active school year record from the 'schoolyear' table using the Supabase API.

It retrieves the data where the 'is_active' field is true. If there is an error during the fetch operation, it sets the Outputs.Error output to the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure signal.

If the fetch operation is successful, it sets the Outputs.ActiveSchoolYear output to the first record in the data array (assuming only one active school year record) and triggers the Outputs.Success signal.

roots.label: Check if JSON Array is Empty

history.content: If input json array is empty output true else output false

This function checks if a JSON array is empty or not. It takes the Inputs.Json as input, checks if it is empty or not, and sets the Outputs.IsEmpty output accordingly. If the JSON array is empty, it sets the output to true; otherwise, it sets it to false. Finally, it triggers Outputs. output accordingly. If the JSON array is empty, it sets the output to true; otherwise, it sets it to false. Finally, it triggers output signal.
Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to upsert records to the table "participation" using an id and by updateing the column 'is_verified' to TRUE

This function updates the verification status of a participation record in a Supabase database. It takes the Inputs.Id as input, constructs an object with the updated verification status, and then uses the Supabase client to perform an upsert operation on the 'participation' table with the provided id and updated data. If the operation is successful, it triggers Outputs. as input, constructs an object with the updated verification status, and then uses the Supabase client to perform an upsert operation on the 'participation' table with the provided id and updated data. If the operation is successful, it triggers output signal. If there is an error during the operation, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error details and triggers Outputs. output signal. If there is an error during the operation, it sets the Outputs.error output with the error details and triggers output signal.

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

history.content: Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to delete records from the table "participation" using an id

This function deletes a record from the "participation" table in the Supabase database based on the provided id. It first checks if the Supabase client is available and if the id is provided. Then, it sends a delete request to the "participation" table with the specified id. If the deletion is successful, it triggers the Outputs.Success signal. If there is an error during the deletion process, it sets the Outputs. signal. If there is an error during the deletion process, it sets the signal.

parameters.functionScript: const id = Inputs.id;

history.content: Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table profiles based on an input id

This function fetches profile data from a Supabase database based on the provided ID. It first checks if the Inputs. This function fetches profile data from a Supabase database based on the provided ID. It first checks if the is provided, if not, it triggers Outputs. is provided, if not, it triggers output signal and exits the function. Then, it retrieves the Supabase client from the Noodl variables. If the client is not available, it throws an error. The function then queries the 'profiles' table in the database to fetch the profile data corresponding to the provided ID. If successful, it sets the Outputs.Profile output with the fetched data and triggers Outputs. output with the fetched data and triggers output signal. If no data is found, it triggers the Outputs.Failure output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal.
get timestamp input and output in the following format: [Dayofweek, Day, Month, Year]

This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into an array containing the day of the week, day of the month, month, and year.

It first checks if an input timestamp is provided, if not, it uses the current timestamp. Then it converts the timestamp to a date object and extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month name, and year.

Finally, it sets the Outputs.Timestamp to an array containing the formatted date components.
no commas, custom print

This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into a human-readable date string.

It extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month, and year from the timestamp. Then, it constructs a formatted date string combining these elements.

The formatted date string is then set to
This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into a human-readable date string.

It extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month, and year from the timestamp. Then, it constructs a formatted date string combining these elements.

The formatted date string is then set to
Add time

This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into a human-readable date and time string. It extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month, year, hours, minutes, and seconds from the timestamp. Then, it constructs a formatted string combining all these elements. The formatted timestamp string is then set to Outputs. This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into a human-readable date and time string. It extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month, year, hours, minutes, and seconds from the timestamp. Then, it constructs a formatted string combining all these elements. The formatted timestamp string is then set to output.
add if AM or PM

This function takes a timestamp as input and formats it into a human-readable date and time string. It extracts the day of the week, day of the month, month, year, hours, minutes, seconds, and period (AM/PM) from the timestamp. The formatted date and time string is then assigned to the Outputs.Timestamp property.

accepts string input. is the string is spaces or empty output isEmpty else output Click()

This function checks if the user input is empty or not. It Inputs.Input as input, assigns it to the variable userInput with a default empty string value. If the trimmed userInput is empty, it triggers Outputs.isEmpty output signal.
Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to retrieve records from the table activities where column id is equal to an input. Output the desc column

This function fetches the description of an activity based on the provided ID from a Supabase database. It takes Inputs. This function fetches the description of an activity based on the provided ID from a Supabase database. It takes as input, checks if the ID is provided, and if not, triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal. It then uses the Supabase client to query the 'activities' table for the description of the activity with the specified ID. If there is an error during the query, it sets the Outputs.Error output with the error message and triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal. If the query is successful, it sets the Outputs.Description output with the fetched description, or an empty string if no description is found, and triggers the Outputs.Success output signal.

history.content: Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to insert records to the table schoolyear's columns desc and yearvalue

as inputs, checks if both inputs are provided. If either input is missing, it triggers the Outputs.Failure output signal and exits the function. The function then uses the Noodl API to insert a new record into the 'schoolyear' table with the provided description and year value. If there is an error during the insertion, it sets Outputs. output signal and exits the function. The function then uses the Noodl API to insert a new record into the 'schoolyear' table with the provided description and year value. If there is an error during the insertion, it sets output and triggers the Outputs. output and triggers the output signal. If the insertion is Outputs. output signal. If the insertion is output signal.

Create a function that uses supabase javascript client called Noodl.Variables.supabase to update records from the table schoolyear. Where, a provided id will be used to find the record and make that record's 'is_active' to true and update all the other records to false

This function updates a school year record in a Supabase database by setting the 'is_active' field to true for the specified record and false for all other records. Inputs. This function updates a school year record in a Supabase database by setting the 'is_active' field to true for the specified record and false for all other records. as input to identify the specific record to update. The function first retrieves the record with the provided id, then updates all records to set 'is_active' to false except the specified record which has 'is_active' set to true. If the update operations are successful, it triggers Outputs. as input to identify the specific record to update. The function first retrieves the record with the provided id, then updates all records to set 'is_active' to false except the specified record which has 'is_active' set to true. If the update operations are successful, it triggers output signal. If there is an error during the Outputs. output signal. If there is an error during the output with the error message and triggers the Outputs. output with the error message and triggers the output signal.

settings.headCode:
<script src="https://unpkg.com/jspdf@latest/dist/jspdf.umd.min.js"></script>
<script type="module">
    import { createClient } from 'https://esm.sh/@supabase/supabase-js@2.22.0';
    window.createClient = createClient;  
</script>

<script type="module">
    import { jsPDF } from "jspdf";
</script>
